message: I'd really like to see Convore integrated into XMPP so I could connect to Convore through an IM client and use it in that fashion. The Spec, if you're interested: http://xmpp.org/extensions/xep-0045.html
@mko Would that work with our added structure of topics?
every topic becomes a separate room at least…
It'd likely require a bit more investigation, but I definitely would be interested in each Topic being a Room in my IM client that I could open/close whenever I feel like it.
I don't use/know XMPP so well, but how do you discover rooms? is there a room list? could that be a nested list of groups->topics?

@judofyr http://xmpp.org/extensions/xep-0059.html describes the protocol extension for managing result sets of rooms. Additionally, you could click on a button in your web browser on a Topic or Group to open either the Topic List (if clicking in a group) or the Topic itself (if clicking in a topic) in your IM client.
Yeah, this wouldn't be too bad, especially considering the Redis base.

IMHO one room per group would be sufficient, iff notifications were prefixed with [MyTopic] and answering via jabber with a prefix of [MyTopic] would go to the relevant topic. Maybe even [MyGroup:MyTopic]. It wouldn't even have to be a room: taking yammer as an example, you have one 'buddy' in your list, say MyGroup@jabber.convore.com. and again, this would not have to be restricted to XMPP, but could be used with any IM...
this would help me get more friends on convore
XMPP integration would be truly cool!
